repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Public Sector Modernization
            Structural Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts are substantial. Lessons reinforce that
            government commitment is key in ensuring success, reflected
            in this operation in the Borrower's own priorities
            being ensured by government support, even in the face of
            great challenges, such as the devastation brought by
            Hurricane Mitch. Moreover, in this case, the use of multiple
            instruments to support Bank interventions, built on the
            foundations of exhaustive sector work, provided diagnosis on
            the challenges the country's public sector had to face;
            and as well, was enhanced by a companion technical
            assistance loan, focused on the groundwork of policy actions
            pursued by the project. However, given the complexity, and
            specific know-how of the reforms supported by the project,
            several operations could have been used to increase the
            focus of individual reforms. For example, implementation of
            the financial administration system, could have been
            accomplished using a physical investment loan, while
            similarly, sector-specific adjustment loans may be more
            effective in supporting ambitious reforms. Further lessons
            specify the need for well defined loan conditionality; for
            adequate supervision, and close monitoring of the overall
            country situation; to adequately consider the complexity of
            legal frameworks, and regulatory bodies for sustainable
            privatization, and concessions; and, for coordinating with
            other international financial institutions, to ensure
            consistent policy approach towards borrowers.
